body: @fzyzcjy SphereEx
@lyflyy hi seems that this group is jist created? https://zhuanlan.zhihu.com/p/377722646 So is there tech support *now*?

Hi,  SphereEx is a commercial entity of ShardingSphere. Any business collaboration request, you could direct touch with us at email address biz@sphere-ex.com. As to general tech supporting, suggest you submit to ShardingSphere community on Github.

@lyflyy Thanks! Where can I enter the group?

@zllegend521 Thanks! I will send an email

@zllegend521

About "submit to ShardingSphere community on Github", do you mean exactly this github repository - i.e. just create issues like what I have done?

I have heard that apache or shardingsphere uses email to communicate. So shall I use email as well? Or, is there anything like slack?

With my previous experiments on Vitess (CNCF graduated project), I found that the community on Vitess are not very reactive... Many questions have no answer. So I am worried whether ShardingSphere is similar.
What's the version of MySQL JDBC driver?

> What's the version of MySQL JDBC driver?

<dependency>
    <groupId>mysql</groupId>
    <artifactId>mysql-connector-java</artifactId>
    <version>5.1.5</version>
</dependency>

thanks.
Will approach you in the group of Wechat.
I guest it may be the net enviroment problem. I just run "mvn install" successfully with the newest codes in wndows env through my nexus server.
The class DistSQLStatementParserEngineTest split to multiple classes, I just update the issue, please check.

Cool, @sandynz 

So do you think we can carry on with the remaining tasks? Maybe show the correct user, host, info of its result. Or Add more SQLStatement branches in `ExecuteProcessStrategyEvaluator`?

Hi @tristaZero, In my opinion, the "ShardingSphereDataSource" should be created and inited faster, and the "StandardMetaDataContexts" should be lazy loaded  to avoid slow down the system. Now, "ShardingSphereDataSource" will direct invoke "OptimizeContextFactory" to call "FederateLogicSchema.initTables" which slow down the system with hundreds of databases in startups. 
Can this be improved?
Hi my suggestion is to consider 5.0.0-alpha or beta. @fzyzcjy

> 
> 
> So do you think we can carry on with the remaining tasks? Maybe show the correct user, host, info of its result. Or Add more SQLStatement branches in `ExecuteProcessStrategyEvaluator`?

That's ok.

> Why do you remove `rowPatternClause`, `pivotClause` and `unpivotClause` ?

![Error](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/48581379/122182419-e6161800-cea7-11eb-98af-0edc74367ca9.png)

Even if I try to add one rule among those three rules, the error stays the same. 

If I remove those three rules then there are no more errors and I can able to use auto-generated contexts:

![NoError](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/48581379/122184364-c4b62b80-cea9-11eb-9983-c854e30e0951.png)

I hope the above-mentioned errors aren't specific to me. Can you please check whether you can able to reproduce the same error?
